Name: Shabti of king Senkamanisken
Description: This funerary statuette was discovered in the pyramid of  king Senkamanisken at Nuri. Characteristic for a large part of  these shabtis of the grandson and third successor of  Taharqa is the presence of the double uraeus. This symbol of domination over Upper Egypt and Lower Egypt is here combined with the "nemes" head-dress (compare E.6097). In the crossed hands, the shabti is holding the whip and the royal sceptre. The hieroglyphic text engraved in six horizontal lines contains Chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead.
